review: Tasty food at reasonable rates. It's a nice new hotel with clean washroom. Service is also quick with an average wait of 15min. There is also enough parking for cars so it's a good place to stop on road for good lunch or dinner. The only downside is no paper towels or rolls in washroom which is very inconvenient for tourists. Still I will rate it 5* for taste and price 👌🏻

This is an excellent spot to enjoy a meal with friends and family. The location is prime, and the service is top-notch. Whether you're planning a casual get-together with friends or a special family dinner, this place won't disappoint. The area is well-known for its vibrant atmosphere, making it a perfect backdrop for memorable dining experiences. Moreover, the service here is commendable. The staff is attentive and prompt, ensuring that you and your loved ones have a smooth and enjoyable dining experience. So, if you're looking for a place that offers great food, a fantastic location, and exceptional service, this is the place to be.

Kiyan is one of the top places in Gurugram for Lunch and Dinner. The property boasts an amazing atmosphere with scenic beauty and greenery. Where they make up with the view, they do lack a little bit on the flavours. Their signature special dal makhani is not so special.The taste may vary depending on your preference but overall an average experience on the food.

The staff was friendly and laid-back, making us feel right at home. Plus, the prices are reasonable, which is always a plus.Overall, kiyan is a great spot to grab some tasty food and unwind with friends. Can't wait to come back and try more from their menu!

The service was exceptional, and the food was delicious. The ambiance created a welcoming . Every dish we ordered was expertly prepared and bursting with flavor. The staff were attentive and ensured our needs were met throughout the meal. Overall, our visit to Kiyan was thoroughly enjoyable, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great dining experience."

Kiyan Hotel in New Delhi offers a delightful culinary experience with a diverse menu that caters to various tastes. The ambiance is elegant, creating a pleasant dining atmosphere. The service is generally attentive, and the staff is courteous. While the pricing may be on the higher side, the overall dining experience makes it a notable choice for those seeking a sophisticated meal in the heart of New Delhi.

Totally awesome!I stayed here for 2 days. And I noticed there are cleaning staff and do housekeeping every day. And public place was also cleaned. Speaking of the staff every front desk employee were so careful for me and generous. I’ll definitely come back here when I stay SF. Thanks.

So we were at this beautiful hotel The Roseate in Samalkha and hosted a lunch table for our friends at one their restaurants "Kiyan".The theme was sustainable food with all the veggies and poultry from their 0KM farms. #ChefAnandPanwar was very generous and courteous in having us here. He presented some of their signature dishes prepared from handpicked veggies from the farm by the chef himself.So it began with their signature drink which was apple juice with a hint of cinnamon and ginger ale it was indeed refreshing in this hot summer.Then we had the tomato soup which was served over orange slice and blanch cherry tomato along with focaccia bread. It was just so delicious , despite me being a non lover of soups , I just loved this tomato soup light yet flavorful.For the snacks we had the paneer tikka with mango marmalade inside, it was delicious combo.Next was pathar ke ghost, which mutton chunks grilled and delicious, for the main course we had the dal makhani paneer curry bhurji and nalli nihari
Staff service is very good 👍, fooad quality is fresh, hygenic food,overall whole facality is good.

Kiyan, the signature all day dining restaurant at The Roseate New Delhi.A visit to Roseate can best be termed as a luxurios  experience in the lap of nature, yes NATURE which is hard to find in Delhi.The mesmerizing ambience, beautifully manicured gardens, water bodies and lots of sparrows and colourful birds can be seen roaming around in the greens.It instantly reminded me of a resort in Kerala which I visited for my honeymoon 10 years back.Amidst this beautiful setting, be ready to satisfy your hungry stomachs with some lip smacking food  with ever attentive and polite but non-intruding service at Kiyan.We were served their welcome drink Moksha a refreshing drink and a bread basket with nicely baked breads with butter.There is no better feeling when you visit a restaurant and the chef comes to your table to greet you.The Chef Mr Anand Panwar was kind enough to come to our table and ask us about our food preferences and tastes.He informed us that they were having an ongoing  Bangkok food festival festival till 15th June so we made up our mind to have a Thai Lunch.We ordered the following :Wild Mushroom SoupBangkok Spring RollsThai Green Curry ChickenThai Red Curry ChickenPhad Thai GoongJasmin RiceCashew ChickenKiyan Signature DessertI must confess that I haven’t had a better Mushroom Soup than the one we were offered here. It cant get any better for sure, it packed the power punch of Mushroms with a presentation that was a visual delight.The consistency(thickness)  of the curries in Thai cuisine  varies with the amount of coconut milk used and here the consistency and the taste were just perfect for both Red & Green Curry.One could feel the flavours of  green chillies, shallots, garlic, galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime peel, cilantro roots etc.Pad Thai Goong turned out to be a  perfect combination of the popular Pad Thai (rice noodle) and some crunchy prawns.Cashew Chicken was a burst of  flavours of tender peppers and onions with perfectly cooked golden brown chicken, and a sauce that will make you ask for more…Kiyan Signature dessert was the Toffee Coffee Pudding :Sticky toffee puddings can be unbearably sweet, but this one, flecked with ginger and coated in a coffee toffee sauce topped with Vanila Ice Cream  was perfect.Puddings don't get more gloriously indulgent than this one.Our sincere thanks to the Chef Mr Anand Panwar  for serving us a memorable meal.Will definitely come back with family for a weekend stay.

Nice place to stay with family. Food is also very tasty.

Recently, I hosted the table for LBB insiders table at the roseate, Kiyan. This is fine dine place serving delicious Indian cuisine.So, we went here to try their new sustainable menu launch which wss made of ingredients hand picked by chef within 0kms of their premises.Location and ambience is quite good !We started the table with their welcome drink, which was made of apple cinnamon, gingle ale ! This was quite refreshing.Next we were served Tomato soup and Herb Focaccia bread. Trust me this is a must try here !Tomato soup had a tinge of orange which was perfect.Focaccia bread was made with utter perfection.In starters, we were served pathar ke gosht which beautiful presented and tasted amazing.We tried paneer tikka with mango marmalade , paneer cubes were quite big and single piece was enough for 1 person.In mains, we tried khichdi with vaddi which was quite an amazing dish on their menu ! Would recommend that.Next, nalli nihari , which was ok to try.Paneer gravy was as well ok to try.Last we tried their dessert, kiyan signature which was pudding served with ice cream and hot toffee caramel sauce. This was realy nice !Thanks to Chef Anand Panwar for hosting us. It was a pleasant experience here !!

Best place for Thai food lovers why I say this coz they maintain the authenticity of Thai food flavors.A fine dining restaurant Kiyan, set amidst majestic columns and water bodies serves world cuisine that is sourced from organic, home grown vegetables .Now about food n desertsAs in starting we get served a welcome drink , after getting ready for what we should try we ask chef Anand  recommendation first after tht , we decide to go for Thai authentic food only as you know this place is Gem for Thai food lovers.Starting from soup we order mushroom soup n tom kha authentic Thai soup which is based of coconut n lemon grass n coriander leaves n ginger chunks along with nice chicken pieces . Seriously saying soup is dam awesome but my heart stuck on mushroom soup I never had such a thick mushroom soup ever n better than this seriously I m loving it.After tht we had some Thai spring rolls as they are having Bangkok food festival so go with flow n see their creative's dishes with full of authentic flavours so we ask chef Anand to suggestions about food .Than in main course we have both Thai curry green n red both non veg but super tasty . And some pad Thai prawns based n some vegetables along with Jasmine sticky rice .All dishes r awesome along with there signature desert as per chef suggest us we order tht one I must say u guys r gem keep growing n stay blessed guys u hve done .Over all love place  with solid here

I am a Roseate Prive member since 2021. This is my second membership in a row and I’m quite sure I would not be renewing it for the third time. Over a span of two years the service, quality and hospitality have gone down quite drastically. For Prive members they have a special set menu for the vouchers which has such limited options and it has been the same since 2 years. Like why would someone re new the membership to eat the same dishes over and over again. It is soo boring and monotonous. My last visit was on my birthday eve and I was highly dissatisfied. I had placed an order for the cake a week back and upon my arrival I did mention that I have pre booked the cake and the staff was soo confused and clueless. They did give me a cake after a lot of re- confirmations but to my disappointment that was stale too. Initially the cake had such nice beautiful exotic fruits and now it just had few apples, pears and grapes. It was really bad. The second issue was the portion size. Last year for starters I got full portion of appetizers and this time just 2 pieces. Like is it a JOKE? upon asking the manager he very conveniently said the last time you must have got full portions by mistake but as a standard we serve only two pieces of appetizers under fixed menu. I mean once could be a mistake but getting full portions thrice cant be a mistake for sure. I mean imagine 2 pcs of appetizer for one person? Its shameful. The class, quality and service has really gone down. I mean the restaurant felt nothing less that an old sick unit. It has lost its charm.
